item.title:
Just started prompting ChatGPT for some advanced knowledge on Pandas until I found something interesting.
Honestly discovered a TON of cool features in pandas I would have had no idea existed.
Try it.

item.title: R to @quant_arb: The fact that he thought OHLCV was acceptable and wouldn’t produce garbage says all you need
item.dc:creator: @quant_arb
item.description: The fact that he thought OHLCV was acceptable and wouldn’t produce garbage says all you need

item.title:
For those interested in why:
1) MACD vs BP is not a very useful question in the first place
2) lot of random stuff thrown in there (jumps, correlations, triple barrier) which sounds cool but has no relevance / information value
3) super basic research question when you remove the random shit thrown in there which should take <1h to answer
4) 24h is far too short a sample period & doesn’t cover multiple regimes.
5) the performance difference is slight so given #4 it’s barely significant
6) OHLCV data. Like come on. This is hft and you couldn’t be bothered to pay a couple hundred for a Tardis API or apply for orderbook data from binance. You choose to use Binance OHLCV data???
I can’t believe he published this
item.dc:creator: @quant_arb
item.description:
For those interested in why:

1) MACD vs BP is not a very useful question in the first place

2) lot of random stuff thrown in there (jumps, correlations, triple barrier) which sounds cool but has no relevance / information value

3) super basic research question when you remove the random shit thrown in there which should take <1h to answer

4) 24h is far too short a sample period & doesn’t cover multiple regimes.

5) the performance difference is slight so given #4 it’s barely significant

6) OHLCV data. Like come on. This is hft and you couldn’t be bothered to pay a couple hundred for a Tardis API or apply for orderbook data from binance. You choose to use Binance OHLCV data???

I can’t believe he published this

item.title: R to @quant_arb: I see people argue about what to learn but there's plenty of roadmaps out there just through uni programmes or masters programmes.
item.dc:creator: @quant_arb
item.description: I see people argue about what to learn but there's plenty of roadmaps out there just through uni programmes or masters programmes.

item.title:
You can always just find the programme for any quant finance degree and just learn the material on your own time if you want to brush up on quant math in a structured way.
https://www.lse.ac.uk/study-at-lse/undergraduate/degree-programmes-2024/bsc-financial-mathematics-and-statistics
item.dc:creator: @quant_arb
